title: Linux mdadm Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the power of the Linux mdadm command with this practical lab. Learn to create, manage, and monitor software RAID arrays, enhancing your system's storage and reliability.

meta.title: Linux mdadm Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the power of the Linux mdadm command with this practical lab. Learn to create, manage, and monitor software RAID arrays, enhancing your system's storage and reliability.
meta.keywords: Linux, mdadm, software RAID, disk management, file system utilities, storage, reliability

steps.title: Understand the Concept of Software RAID

verify.name: Verify understanding of software RAID
verify.hint: Make sure you have the `mdadm` package installed, which is used to manage software RAID arrays in Linux.

steps.title: Create a Software RAID Array Using mdadm

verify.name: Verify creation of RAID 5 array
verify.hint: Make sure the `mdadm --detail /dev/md0` command shows a RAID level of 5.

steps.title: Manage and Monitor the Software RAID Array

verify.name: Verify addition of spare disk
verify.hint: Make sure the `mdadm --detail /dev/md0` command shows that there is 1 spare device in the RAID array.

verify.name: Verify degraded RAID array
verify.hint: Make sure the `mdadm --detail /dev/md0` command shows that the RAID array is in a "clean, degraded" state.
